==Events==
*[[36 BC]] &ndash; In the [[Battle of Naulochus]], [[Marcus Vipsanius Agrippa]], [[admiral]] of [[Caesar Augustus|Octavian]], defeats [[Sextus Pompeius]], son of [[Pompey]], thus ending Pompeian resistance to the [[Second Triumvirate]].
* [[301]] &ndash; [[San Marino]], one of the [[List of countries by area|smallest nations in the world]] and the world's oldest [[republic]] still in existence, is founded by [[Saint Marinus]].
* [[590]] &ndash; Consecration of [[Pope Gregory I]] (Gregory the Great).
* [[673]] &ndash; King [[Wamba (king)|Wamba]] of the [[Visigoths]] puts down a revolt by [[Hilderic of Nimes|Hilderic]], governor of [[Nîmes]] ([[France]]) and rival for the [[throne]].
* [[863]] &ndash; Major [[Byzantine Empire|Byzantine]] victory at the [[Battle of Lalakaon]] against an Arab raid.
*[[1189]] &ndash; [[Richard I of England]] (a.k.a. Richard "the Lionheart") is crowned at [[Westminster Abbey|Westminster]].
*[[1260]] &ndash; The [[Mamluks]] defeat the [[Mongols]] at the [[Battle of Ain Jalut]] in [[Palestine (region)|Palestine]], marking their first decisive defeat and the point of maximum expansion of the [[Mongol Empire]].
*[[1650]] &ndash; [[Third English Civil War]]: in the [[Battle of Dunbar (1650)|Battle of Dunbar]], English [[Roundhead|Parliamentarian]] forces led by [[Oliver Cromwell]] defeat an army loyal to King [[Charles II of England]] and led by [[David Leslie, Lord Newark]].
*[[1651]] &ndash; Third English Civil War: [[Battle of Worcester]] &ndash; [[Charles II of England]] is defeated in the last main battle of the war.
*[[1658]] &ndash; [[Richard Cromwell]] becomes [[Lord Protector]] of [[England]]
*[[1666]] &ndash; The [[Royal Exchange, London|Royal Exchange]] burns down in the [[Great Fire of London]]
*[[1777]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: during the [[Battle of Cooch's Bridge]], the [[Flag of the United States]] is flown in battle for the first time.
*[[1783]] &ndash; American Revolutionary War: the war ends with the signing of the [[Treaty of Paris (1783)|Treaty of Paris]] by the [[United States]] and the [[Kingdom of Great Britain]].
*[[1798]] &ndash; The week long battle of [[Battle of St. George's Caye|St. George's Caye]] begins between [[Spain]] and [[Kingdom of Great Britain|Britain]] off the coast of [[Belize]].
*[[1802]] &ndash; [[William Wordsworth]] composes the sonnet ''[[Composed upon Westminster Bridge, September 3, 1802]]''.
*[[1812]] &ndash; 24 settlers are killed in the [[Pigeon Roost State Historic Site#Pigeon Roost Massacre|Pigeon Roost Massacre]] in [[Indiana]].
*[[1838]] &ndash; Future [[Abolitionism in the United States|abolitionist]] [[Frederick Douglass]] escapes from  [[slavery]].
*[[1855]] &ndash; [[American Indian Wars]]: in [[Nebraska]], 700 soldiers under [[United States]] [[General]] [[William S. Harney]] avenge the [[Grattan Massacre]] by attacking a [[Sioux]] village and killing 100 men, women and children.
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] [[General]] [[Leonidas Polk]] invades neutral [[Kentucky]], prompting the state legislature to ask for [[United States|Union]] assistance.
*[[1870]] &ndash; [[Franco-Prussian War]]: the [[Siege of Metz]] begins, resulting in a decisive [[Kingdom of Prussia|Prussian]] victory on October 23.
*[[1874]] &ndash; The congress of the [[States of Mexico|state]] of [[Mexico (state)|México]] elevates [[Naucalpan]] to the category of [[Villa]], with the title of "Villa de [[Benito Juárez|Juárez]]".
*[[1875]] &ndash; The first official game of [[Polo]] is played in [[Argentina]] after being introduced by [[United Kingdom|British]] Ranchers.
*[[1878]] &ndash; Over 640 die when the crowded pleasure boat {{SS|Princess Alice|1865|2}} collides with the ''[[Bywell Castle]]'' in the [[River Thames]].
*[[1895]] &ndash; [[John Brallier]] became the first openly professional [[American football]] player, when he was paid [[USD|$]]10 by [[Dave Berry (American football)|David Berry]], to play for the [[Latrobe Athletic Association]] in a 12-0 win over the [[Jeanette Athletic Association]].
*[[1914]] &ndash; [[William, Prince of Albania]] leaves the country after just six months due to opposition to his rule.
*[[1914]] &ndash; French composer [[Albéric Magnard]] killed after shooting at invading German soldiers.
*[[1914]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: Start of the [[Battle of Grand Couronné]], a German assault against French positions on high ground near the city of [[Nancy, France|Nancy]].  
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: [[Leefe Robinson]] destroys the German [[airship]] [[Schütte-Lanz SL 11]] over [[Cuffley]], north of [[London]]; the first German airship to be shot down on British soil.
*[[1925]] &ndash; [[USS Shenandoah (ZR-1)|USS ''Shenandoah'' (ZR-1)]], the United States' first American-built rigid airship, was destroyed in a [[squall line]] over [[Noble County, Ohio|Noble County]], [[Ohio]]. Fourteen of her 42-man crew perished, including her commander, [[Zachary Lansdowne]].
*[[1933]] &ndash; [[Yevgeniy Abalakov]] is the first man to reach the highest point in the [[Soviet Union]], [[Ismoil Somoni Peak|Communism Peak]] (now called Ismoil Somoni Peak and situated in [[Tajikistan]]) (7495 m).
*[[1935]] &ndash; Sir [[Malcolm Campbell]] reaches a speed of 304.331 miles per hour on the [[Bonneville Salt Flats]] in [[Utah]], becoming the first person to drive an [[automobile]] over 300&nbsp;mph
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[France]], the [[United Kingdom]], [[New Zealand]] and [[Australia]] declare war on [[Germany]] after the [[invasion of Poland]], forming the [[Allies of World War II|Allies]].
*  1939   &ndash; World War II: The United Kingdom and France begin a [[Blockade of Germany (1939–1945)|naval blockade of Germany]] that lasts until the end of the war. This also marks the beginning of the [[Battle of the Atlantic]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[The Holocaust]]: [[Karl Fritzsch]], deputy camp commandant of the [[Auschwitz concentration camp]], experiments with the use of [[Zyklon B]] in the gassing of Soviet POWs.
*1941 &ndash; World War II: The first [[Gas chamber#Nazi Germany|gas chamber]] experiments are conducted at [[Auschwitz]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; World War II: In response to news of its coming liquidation, [[Dov Lopatyn]] leads an uprising in the [[Łachwa Ghetto#Uprising and massacre|Ghetto]] of [[Lakhva]], in present-day [[Belarus]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: The [[Allied invasion of Italy]] begins on the same day that U.S. General [[Dwight D. Eisenhower]] and Italian Marshal [[Pietro Badoglio]] sign [[Armistice between Italy and Allied armed forces|an armistice]] aboard the [[Royal Navy]] battleship {{HMS|Nelson|28|6}} off [[Malta]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; Holocaust: [[diarist]] [[Anne Frank]] and her family are placed on the last transport train from the [[Westerbork transit camp]] to the [[Auschwitz concentration camp]], arriving three days later.
*[[1945]] &ndash; Three-day celebration was held in [[China]], following the [[Victory over Japan Day#China|Victory over Japan Day]] on September 2.
*[[1950]] &ndash; [[Giuseppe Farina|"Nino" Farina]] becomes the first [[List of Formula One World Drivers' Champions|Formula One Drivers' champion]] after winning the [[1950 Italian Grand Prix]].
*[[1951]] &ndash; The first long-running American television [[soap opera]], ''[[Search for Tomorrow]]'', airs its first episode on the [[CBS]] network.
*[[1954]] &ndash; The [[People's Liberation Army]] begins shelling the [[Republic of China]]-controlled islands of [[Quemoy]], starting the [[First Taiwan Strait Crisis]].
*  1954   &ndash; The [[Germany|German]] [[U-Boat]] [[U-505]] begins its move from a specially constructed dock to its final site at [[Chicago]]'s [[Museum of Science and Industry (Chicago)|Museum of Science and Industry]].
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Dagen H]] in [[Sweden]]: traffic changes from driving on the left to driving on the right overnight.
*[[1971]] &ndash; [[Qatar]] becomes an independent state.
*[[1976]] &ndash; [[Viking program]]: The American ''[[Viking 2]]'' spacecraft lands at [[Utopia Planitia]] on [[Mars]].
*[[1987]] &ndash; In a [[1987 Burundian coup d'état|coup d'état in Burundi]], President [[Jean-Baptiste Bagaza]] is deposed by Major [[Pierre Buyoya]].
*[[1994]] &ndash; [[Sino-Soviet Split]]: [[Russia]] and the [[People's Republic of China]] agree to de-target their [[nuclear weapon]]s against each other.
*[[1997]] &ndash; [[Vietnam Airlines]] [[Vietnam Airlines Flight 815|Flight 815]] ([[Tupolev]] [[TU-134]]) crashes on approach into [[Phnom Penh]] airport, killing 64.
*[[2001]] &ndash; In [[Belfast]], Protestant [[Ulster loyalism|loyalists]] begin a [[Holy Cross dispute|picket of Holy Cross]], a Catholic [[primary school]] for girls. For the next 11 weeks, riot police escort the schoolchildren and their parents through hundreds of protesters, some of whom hurl missiles and abuse. The protest sparks fierce rioting and grabs world headlines. 
*[[2004]] &ndash; [[Beslan school hostage crisis]] &ndash; day 3: the Beslan hostage crisis ends with the deaths of over 300 people, more than half of which are children.
